intro: Monnina celastroides, commonly known as redroot stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
